Description: Fragment of Attic red-figured pottery kylix; inside, part of decoration of tondo: a bearded man leaning on his stick, with his head frontal (face, right hand, left shoulder and left upper arm preserved), gesturing with upturned hand to a male figure (probably a youth) who may sit to the left, his head bent (part of the hair with purple headband is preserved).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
From the tondo of the cup to which belong the fragments AN1896-1908-G.138.3 and 11. Beazley (ARV) says the man 'is no doubt dictating'; plausible but significant if so.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (pl. 14.30)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1510)
Exhibition history: On loan to Classics Centre in Oxford.
